x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During natural disasters like floods, droughts, or conflicts, NGOs and community responders face massive coordination problems. Aid efforts are often duplicated in some areas while others receive no help at all. Communication gaps, lack of real-time field data, and poor logistics tracking delay response and waste resources.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ReliefLink would be built on the ServiceNow App Engine to manage disaster cases and coordinate multiple NGO responses.

Flow Designer to automate alerts, resource assignments, and status updates.

Integration Hub to connect weather APIs, logistics systems, and mapping tools.

Performance Analytics to visualize disaster impact zones and track ongoing aid deliveries.

Mobile App / Portal for field agents to log ground reports and upload photos in real time.

 

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

ReliefLink will be built on ServiceNow to automate, coordinate, and visualize relief operations:

  • App Engine: Core platform for case management and relief activity tracking.
  • Flow Designer: Automates alerts, dispatch approvals, and volunteer tasking.
  • Integration Hub: Connects to external APIs like weather data, logistics systems, and map services for situational awareness.
  • Performance Analytics: Provides real-time dashboards of aid progress, response times, and critical areas.
  • Service Portal / Mobile App: Allows field agents and citizens to report incidents, upload photos, and request support directly.
  • CMDB: Maps shelters, hospitals, and infrastructure assets involved in disaster response.

Technical Dependencies

  • Weather and satellite data APIs (e.g., OpenWeatherMap, Mapbox)
  • NGO logistics and supply chain APIs
  • Cloud hosting and mobile integration for real time access

 

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring accurate and verified data from field responders
  • Integrating different NGO systems with standardized formats
  • Maintaining system performance in high traffic emergency situations
  • Training volunteers to use the digital platform effectively
